page.title: 04THE HISTORY OF HOLT.
page.content: THE EARLIEST SETTLEMENT OF PEOPLE IN THE HOLT AREA SEEMS TO BE AFTER EDWARD 1'S CONQUEST OF WALES IN 1282.HE GAVE THE LAND IN THE N.E OF WALES TO ENGLISH BARONS WHO BUILT CASTLES TO DOMINATE EACH AREA.HOLT CASTLE WAS VERY IMPORTANT AS IT CONTROLLED THE ROUTE ACROSS THE RIVER DEE FROM ENGLAND. IN THE EARLY 14th CENTURY HOLT WAS REFERRED TO AS{CAERLLEON}AND IN LATER YEARS AS "LYONS".HOLT IS DERIVED FROM THE WELSH "HOLT" A FISSURE OR CUTTING IN THE CLEFT OF THE ROCKS. EXTENSIVE EXCAVATIONS OF THE LAND AROUND HOLT REVEALED MANY FINDINGS ASSOCIATED WITH A LARGE BUILDING WHICH USED TO STAND ON HOLT HILL. THE PRESENT BRIDGE AT HOLT WAS ERECTED ON THE FORD ACROSS THE RIVER AND A ROMAN ROAD WAS SAID TO HAVE RUN
